text: Arthur Dion "A.D." Hanna (7 March 1928 - 3 August 2021)Profile of Arthur Dion Hanna was a Bahamian politician. He served as Governor-General of the Bahamas from 2006 to 2011. In 1984, Hanna resigned as Deputy Prime Minister in protest of Prime Minister Sir Lynden Pindling. He retired on 14 April 2011 and was replaced by Sir Arthur Foulkes. Hanna died in Nassau on 3 August 2021, aged 93. ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Governors-General of the Bahamas
title: Arthur Dion Hanna
